name: Tickseed
climate: Tickseed thrives in temperate climates that have cold winters and warm summers.
In Mediterranean climates, Tickseed can grow if provided with adequate summer watering.
This plant is also found in continental climates with distinct seasonal temperature differences.
Humidity is not a significant factor for Tickseed, but it prefers environments with some seasonal variation.
sunlight: Tickseed plants require full sun for the best flowering performance.
They can tolerate light shade but may produce fewer blooms in such conditions.
Ideally, Tickseed should receive at least six hours of direct sunlight each day.
Insufficient sunlight can lead to leggy growth and less vibrant flowers.
watering: Tickseed prefers well-drained soil and is drought-tolerant once established.
Watering should be done regularly in the first growing season to establish the plant well.
Overwatering should be avoided as their roots are prone to rot in saturated soil.
During periods of extended drought, provide additional water to keep the plant from wilting.
soil: Tickseed thrives in well-drained soil, such as sandy or gravelly textures.
It can tolerate poor soil conditions but will perform best in fertile loam.
Amending the soil with organic matter improves drainage and nutrient availability.
Avoid heavy clay soils unless amended, as they can retain too much water.
extra_care_tip: To promote continuous blooming, deadhead spent flowers regularly.
Tickseed can be divided every few years in early spring to maintain vigor.
Watch for powdery mildew in humid climates and treat it promptly if needed.
Apply a layer of mulch to help retain soil moisture and suppress weeds.
